data.title: Senate dominated by lawyers, business people
data.meta_description: Honolulu Hawaii News - HonoluluAdvertiser.com is the home page of Honolulu Hawaii with in depth and updated Honolulu local news. Stay informed with both Honolulu Hawaii news as well as headlines and stories from around the world.
data.text:
Posted on: Wednesday, January 16, 2002

THE 2002 HAWAI'I STATE LEGISLATURE

Senate dominated by lawyers, business people

 Where legislators stand on the issues  Reach your legislator: State House of Representatives  Reach your legislator: State Senate  House shifts to more full-time legislators

Sen. Jan Yagi Buen

D4th (W. Maui, Moloka'i, Lana'i)

Born: Dec. 30, 1942

Occupation: retired, Maui Electric Co., Ltd.

Spouse: Richard Combo Buen, retired line foreman in construction, Maui Electric Co.

Political experience: Senate 1998-present

Committees: Agriculture (Chair); Health and Human Services (Vice Chair); Ways and Means, Transportation, Military Affairs, and Government Operations; Tourism and Intergovernmental Affairs

Robert Bunda

D-22nd (Wahiawa, Waialua, Sunset Beach)

Born: April 25, 1947

Occupation: Insurance Broker, Atlas Insurance Agency

Spouse: Gail Bunda, part-time bookkeeper, Tanioka Fish Market

Senate President

Political experience: House 1983-1994; Senate 1994-present

Avery Chumbley

D-6th (E. Maui, N. Kaua'i)

Born: March 19, 1955

Occupation: President and COO, Wailuku Agribusiness Co., Inc.; General Manager, Maui Tropical Plantation

Spouse: Mary Jay, secretary/agent, American Airlines

Political experience: House 1992-94; Senate 1994-present.

Committees: Education (Vice Chair); Commerce, Consumer Protection, and Housing; Labor

Jonathan Chun

D-7th (S. Kaua'i, Ni'ihau)

Born: Jan. 26, 1957

Occupation: attorney

Spouse: Sandra, former office clerk, Prudential Insurance

Political experience: Senate 1998-present

Senate Majority Co-leader

Committees: Hawaiian Affairs (Chair); Agriculture (Vice Chair); Ways and Means; Judiciary; Water, Land, Energy, and Environment

Suzanne Chun Oakland

D-14th (Palama, 'Alewa Heights)

Born: June 27, 1961

Occupation: full-time legislator; former research assistant and office manager to former Honolulu City Council Member Gary Gill

Spouse: Michael Sands Chun Oakland, deputy sheriff, state Department of Public Safety

Political experience: Senate 1996-present; House 1990-1996

Committees: Water, Land, Energy and Environment (Vice Chair); Hawaiian Affairs; Ways and Means; Education

J. Kalani English

D-5th (Kahului, Upcountry Maui)

Born: Aug. 7, 1966

Occupation:

Political experience: Senate 2000-present; Maui County Council 1997-2000

Senate Majority Floor Leader

Committees: Tourism and Intergovernmental Affairs (Vice Chair); Ways and Means; Commerce, Consumer Protecton, and Housing; Health and Human Services; Education; Water, Land, Energy and Environment

Carol Fukunaga

D-12th (Makiki, Ala Moana, Tantalus)

Born: Dec. 12, 1947

Occupation: attorney

Political experience: Senate 1992-present; House 1978-82, 1986-92

Committees: Transportation, Military Affairs, and Government Operations (Vice Chair); Judiciary; Health and Human Services

Colleen Hanabusa

D-21st (Kalaeloa, Makaha)

Born: May 4, 1951

Occupation: attorney

Political experience: Senate 1998-present

Senate Vice President

Committees: Ways and Means (Vice Chair); Hawaiian Affairs; Judiciary; Labor; Agriculture

Fred Hemmings

R-25th (Kailua, Waimanalo)

Born: Jan. 9, 1946

Occupation: Owner/president, Sports Enterprises Inc.

Political experience: Senate 2000-present; House 1984-1990

Senate Minority Floor Leader

Committees: Ways and Means; Water, Land, Energy, and Environment; Transportation, Military Affairs, and Government Operations; Hawaiian Affairs

Bob Hogue

R-24th (Kane'ohe, Kailua)

Born: Sept. 7, 1953

Occupation: freelance columnist for MidWeek, Hawaii Teens on the Go, Markee Magazine; play-by-play announcer, Hawaii Pacific University and Hawaii Sports Network

Spouse: Elaine Hogue, bank executive, American Savings Bank

Political experience: Senate 2000-present

Senate Minority Policy Leader

Committees: Commerce, Consumer Protection, and Housing; Health and Human Services; Education; Agriculture

David Ige

D-17th (Pacific Palisades, Pearl City)

Born: Jan. 15, 1957

Occupation: vice president of engineering, NetEnterprise

Spouse: Dawn Amano-Ige, public school elementary teacher

Political experience: Senate 1994-present; House 1986  1993

Committees: Economic Development and Technology (Vice Chair); Ways and Means; Education

Les Ihara, Jr.

D-10th (Waikiki, Kaimuki)

Born: April 19, 1951

Occupation: full-time legislator; former executive director, Community Work Day Program

Political experience: Senate 1994-present; House 1986-1994

Committees: Labor (Vice Chair); Judiciary; Water, Land, Energy, and Environment; Economic Development and Technology

Lorraine R. Inouye

D-1st (Hawi, N. Kona, Waimea)

Born: June 22, 1940

Occupation: President, Aloha Blooms, Inc. (anthurium farm)

Spouse: Vernon Inouye, President and CEO, Floral Resources

Political experience: Senate 1998-present; Hawaii County Mayor 1990-1992; Hawaii County Council 1984-1990

Committees: Water, Land, Energy and Environment (Chair); Ways and Means; Tourism and Intergovernmental Affairs; Transportation, Military Affairs and Government Operations

Brian Kanno

D-20th ('Ewa Beach, Makakilo, Kapolei)

Born: Oct. 23, 1961

Occupation: father facilitator, Parents and Children Together; youth worker, Boys & Girls Club

Spouse: Lorrie Kanno, program director, YMCA Communities in Schools

Political experience: Senate 1992-present

Committees: Judiciary (Chair); Health and Human Services; Labor; Transportation, Military Affairs, and Government Operations

Cal Kawamoto

D-19th (Waipahu, Pearl City)

Born: April 14, 1940

Occupation: retired, U.S. Air Force

Spouse: Carolyn, accounting clerk, state Department of Transportation

Political experience: Senate 1994-present

Senate Majority Co-leader

Committees: Transportation, Military Affairs and Government Operations (Chair); Ways and Means; Labor; Education; Tourism and Intergovernmental Affairs; Agriculture

Donna Mercado Kim

D-15th (Kalihi Valley, 'Aiea)

Born: July 31, 1952

Occupation: Public Affairs Director, KUMU Radio

Political experience: Senate 2000-Present; Honolulu City Council 1985-2000; State House 1982-1985

Committees: Tourism and Intergovernmental Affairs (Chair); Ways and Means; Commerce, Consumer Protection, and Housing; Economic Development and Technology

Russell Kokubun

D-3rd (Ka'u, Kona)

Born: May 15, 1948

Occupation: former Hawaii County deputy planning director

Spouse: Anne Kokubun, special education administrator, state Department of Education

Political experience: Appointed in 2000 to fill vacancy left by former Sen. Andy Levin; Hawaii County Council 1984-92.

Committees: Hawaiian Affairs (Vice Chair); Judiciary; Health and Human Services; Agriculture; Water, Land, Energy and Environment, Ways and Means

Matt Matsunaga

D-9th (Wai'alae, Palolo)

Born: Nov. 22, 1958

Occupation: attorney, Carlsmith Ball Wichman Case and Ichiki

Political experience: Senate 1992-present

Committees: Commerce, Consumer Protection, and Housing (Vice Chair); Water, Land, Energy, and Environment; Education; Economic Development and Technology

David Matsuura

D-2nd (S. Hilo, Puna)

Born: Feb. 21, 1963

Occupation: owner, Orchid Isle Nursery; General Manager/Corp. Secretary, Umikoa Ranch; Project manager/Corp. Secretary, A & O International

Spouse: Elizabeth Matsuura

Political experience: Senate 1998-present

Committees: Health and Human Services (Chair); Judiciary (Vice Chair); Labor; Tourism and Intergovernmental Affairs; Agriculture

Ron Menor

D-18th (Waipi'o Gentry, Wahiawa)

Born: Sept. 29, 1955

Occupation: attorney

Spouse: Patricia Ann Menor, public school teacher

Political experience: Senate 2000-present, 1986-1990; House 1982-1986, 1992-2000

Committees: Commerce, Consumer Protection, and Housing (Chair); Education; Transportation, Military Affairs and Government Operations

Bob Nakata

D-23rd (Kane'ohe, Kahuku)

Born: April 2, 1941

Occupation: executive director, KEY Project

Spouse: JoAnne, former executive director of Combined Farm Services Agency

Political experience: Senate 1998-present; House 1982  1986

Committees: Labor (Chair); Judiciary; Health and Human Services; Water, Land, Energy and Environment

Norman Sakamoto

D-16th (Moanalua, Salt Lake)

Born: May 22, 1947

Occupation: president, SC Pacific Corp. and Roll-A-Way Shutters of the Pacific

Spouse: Penny Sakamoto, office manager, SC Pacific Corp.

Political experience: Senate 1996-present

Committees: Education (Chair); Tourism and Intergovernmental Affairs; Labor; Ways and Means

Sam Slom

R-8th (Wai'alae Iki, Hawai'i-kai)

Born: April 13, 1942

Occupation: consulting economist, SMS Consultants; executive director, Small Business Hawaii

Spouse: Francine Slom, pre-school teacher

Political experience: Senate 1996-present

Senate Minority Leader

Committees: Judiciary; Labor; Tourism and Intergovernmental Affairs; Economic Development and Technology

Rod Tam

D-13th (Nu'uanu, Downtown, Sand Island)

Born: Oct. 3, 1953

Occupation: life insurance representative; sales representative, Gima Pest Control; travel agent; marketing consultant

Spouse: Lynette Tam, office manager, Akal Security

Political experience: Senate 1994-present; House 1982-94

Committees: Economic Development and Technology (Chair); Transportation, Military Affairs and Government Operations; Education; Ways and Means; Commerce, Consumer Protection and Housing
